person:biography.personal-details:content: Ivan Erill is an associate professor at the Department of Biological Sciences of the University of Maryland Baltimore County (UMBC). His lab works on metagenomics, comparative genomics and theoretical approaches to understand the co-evolution of bacterial transcription factors, their binding sites and resulting transcriptional networks, with a focus on how bacterial transcriptional networks, such as stress responses, evolve to coordinate important aspects of bacterial life like virulence and antibiotic resistance.
